alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 13 at 6:40PM PST until January 14 at 11:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM PST SATURDAY THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of coastal Humboldt County, including areas surrounding Humboldt Bay and the Eel River Delta. * WHEN...From 4 AM PST Saturday through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
